definitions.definition: the method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way.
examples: a study of the way children learn language

definitions.definition: any nonverbal method of expression or communication.
examples: a language of gesture and facial expression

definitions.definition: the system of communication used by a particular community or country.
examples: the book was translated into twenty-five languages

definitions.definition: a system of symbols and rules for writing programs or algorithms.
the manner or style of a piece of writing or speech.
examples: he explained the procedure in simple, everyday language

definitions.definition: the phraseology and vocabulary of a certain profession, domain, or group of people.
synonyms: idiolect; informallingo "the booklet is written in simple
